intro: Parastranthus variifolius, commonly known as the variable-leaf parasitic plant, is a hemiparasitic species native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and relies on host plants for water and nutrients while performing photosynthesis. The plant exhibits a wide range of leaf shapes and sizes, contributing to its common name. It typically grows as a low shrub with yellow or orange flowers. Its unique botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and botanical studies.
